fact_list.fact_text: Warning signs include animals and low flying aircraft ahead.
A raised zebra crossing ahead requires slowing down and stopping for pedestrians to cross.
Drivers should beware of elderly or handicapped pedestrians crossing the road.
Drivers should beware of children crossing the road.
School zones require a speed of 40km/h when amber lights flash alternately.
Drivers should beware of pedestrians crossing the road ahead.
Drivers should slow down and look out for children near the start of a school zone.
Vehicles must not exceed 40km/h in the silver zone if a 40km/h speed limit sign is attached below.
